Description: Head of terracotta female figure with hair worn under a festival wreath headdress, her head to one side. Mould-made and solid with a simple back. Red-brown Nile silt with dark grey core, fine quartz, mica and white inclusions. Traces of white slip or coating.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

'Z4' or '24' written on the back in pencil, possibly a context or find location number. Published by Gutch (1899, no.115). Good parallels from 3rd and 2nd century BC contexts at Athribis (Tell Atrib, Szmańska 2005, nos. 200-2) and published as late 3rd BC (Török 1995, no.216-7). Later parallels include one dated 1st century BC parallel (Bayer Niemeier 1988, no.15) and another dated 'Roman(?)' (Dunand 1990, nos. 701). Bayer Niemeier , E. 1988, Bildwerke der Sammlung Kaufmann / Liebieghaus Museum Alter Plastik Frankfurt am Main I. Griechisch-römische Terrakotten, Melsungen. Dunand, F. 1990. Catalogue des Terres cuites gréco-romaines d’Egypte. Musée du louvre. Musée du Louvre. Département des antiquités égyptiennes. Paris. Szymańska, H. 2005, Terres cuites d’Athribis, Turnhout. Török, L. 1995, Hellenistic and Roman Terracottas from Egypt, Roma.
Bibliographic references: Gutch 1898/1899 / Excavations at Naukratis, D. The Terracottas (p. 84, no. 115)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.443) (Phase 3)
